attributes.action: allow the people to indicate whether or not they want Mr Hans Blix to give testimoney to the Chilcott Inquiry into the Iraq War, through the medium of a referendum.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: It is to satisfy the need of the people of this country to know the truth about what was done by our establishment in the lead up to the Iraq War.  The one man who can shed more light on the subject than any other alive is Mr Hans Blix, the UN weapons inspector during the period in question.  Mr Blix has indicated a willingness to testify but the Chilcott Inquiry have failed to call him - why - is the Chilcott Inquiry under instructions from government, and has already been given their final statement and recommendations, much like the Hutton Inquiry was given its' before it started.  In the absence of any indication from the Inquiry,the people MUST be given an opportunity to indicate if they want Mr Blix to testify.

rejection.details: The calling of witnesses is a matter for the chair
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
